headline: JPMorgan downgrades Krispy Kreme on strategy reset, execution risk
summary: JPMorgan downgraded Krispy Kreme (DNUT) to Neutral from Overweight without a price target. The recent share selloff is largely a function of Krispy Kreme’s “economically driven action” to reset its fresh doughnut delivery expansion strategy, the analyst tells investors in a research note. The firm this includes, most importantly, the temporary pause of the company’s McDonald’s (MCD) rollout currently live in 2,400 stores versus the 6,000 previously expected by this year. headline: Starbucks Is Said to Start Process to Revamp Vast China Business
summary: (Bloomberg) -- Starbucks Corp. has contacted private equity firms, technology companies and others as it considers options for its China business, including a possible stake sale, according to people familiar with the matter.
